Игра неплохая. Но если новичок зайдет в игру ,то над ним 100% будут рофлить. Еще одна вещь которую используют большинство игроков, это кемперство.

Если вы любите терпеть унижения  то эта игра - для Вас. В ней есть всё: пати игроков уровнем выше вас,  замечательные читы,  токсичные пидорасы которые выходят в игру поунижать маньяка. Замечательный продукт с массой багов.

Баланс сломан. Тебя через одну игру кидает к новичкам, а в некст катке ты вылетаешь на 1-5 ранги, где тебя водят хороводами и танцуют на тебе брейк данс с фанариками. А если ты не играешь в игру по их выдуманным правилам, например вешаешь одно человека пару раз подряд, то тебе срут на стенку  - это забавно, хоть какие-то плюсы. А ещё игра до сих пор периодически не тригерит удары, анимации хватания работают через раз, но так как конкурентов у игры нет, приходиться играть в это.
Very fun. A game where you can chill with friends

Trapper my beloved,
When I first laid eyes upon this behemoth of a monster I was starstruck. Trapper is a being which has ascended to the heavens. I began this game devastated and sad, and then i saw HIM. After that day I was never the same, I had achieved the next level of human evolution. This experience has made me become a gigachad and now there are hundreds of people lining up at my doorstep awaiting my presence. Do not be frightened by the Trapper as he shall guide you to a better world. Tarpper is love, Trapper is life.

As a new player I’ve yet to really come across any of the "toxic" members of the community, so I can’t really give my two cents on that as of yet. So far everyone has been lovely. 

The game itself is really fun and entertaining. I’ve clocked 20 hours and have leveled two characters already, and am loving it. The more intense moments come from good killers, and for those moments alone I highly recommend DBD. Plus, if you’re a horror junkie like I am, even better!

I'll start by mentioning everything good about this game. 

- The art direction is on point. Viability/camouflage/all that aside, the flavor of the original maps and characters is fantastic. Many of the original characters have a host of amazing cosmetics. The Hag especially, thematically, is just *chef's kiss." 

- The music is also very good for an indie game. Modern Warfare 2 OST this is not, but the main menu and various holiday themes slap. 

- The gameplay allows for a skill curve. The skill cap is quite high, meaning that there is a tangible benefit to grinding hours into this game learning the maps, perks, killer powers, and so on in addition to just learning how to prioritize.

- There is no other competitive, asymmetrical horror game quite like this one. There are some that are kind of similar, but none that match the level of progression: dozens of perks, characters, and maps that can affect your strategy, the grind of playing hundreds of matches to earn enough points to buy that one perk or cosmetic, etc.

Now for the negatives.

- The game runs very poorly. Unless you have a Twitch streamer PC you'll have to put your graphics settings on potato mode to keep your framerate bearable. There might be a little hyperbole there, but a game with 5 players on smallish maps shouldn't be so demanding.

- Even 5+ years from release, this game is plagued with bugs. It's endless at this point, with new ones being introduced with every update or DLC. And I'm talking game-breaking bugs, bugs that throw matches or crash you to desktop or delete your progress (some of which could be cosmetics or characters you paid irl money for).

- The game is horribly unbalanced. This is due to a couple reasons.

Some killers are crippled by certain maps. Huntress, for example, can hardly use her power (throwing hatchets) in cramped indoor maps. The Shape has difficulty stalking people on wide-open maps. This runs both ways - no Survivor has fun playing against The Doctor on a small indoor map. The problem is that the maps are chosen based on RNG, while the lobby is loading into the game. There is no opportunity to adjust your perk or item loadout to fit the map, let alone your actual character. You can bring some items that slant the RNG toward certain maps, but this is an imprecise science.

Devs will periodically release updates that wildly adjust map layouts, killer powers and base stats, etc. These updates might be based on playerbase feedback, or they could be at a whim. 

The devs themselves don't play the game much and when they do play they get clapped. As such, they have a skewed view of how the game should be played.

The game is built around a lack of voice comms. Too bad Discord exists.

Some perks and items absolutely suck, some are overpowered. You cannot tell me that being able to heal a full health state when the exit gates are powered is the same as having a slightly higher chance of finding a rare item in a chest. Brought a rare map with expensive addons to help find generators quickly? Screw you, the RNG gods chose to send you and your team to the farm map where you can see every generator against the skyline, your map is now useless and you better hope you can escape the game alive with it. 

- Rather than addressing the poor game balance or the spaghetti code, or working toward things like solid servers, the devs have chosen to implement microtransactions (thankfully are not necessary to be competitive in the game) and pump out paid cosmetic DLCs. Where is all that money going, you might ask? To purchase the rights to licensed characters, which then go right back into paid DLC. Your game crashed and you lost all perk progress toward your characters? Well, here's Pinhead. $7 please. 

The devs have open scorn for the playerbase during QnA sessions and in online forums, and clearly are out of touch on what this game sorely needs. Killers are the ones most affected by map/perk reworks, and they're leaving this game in a steady trickle. And I am a Survivor main. It takes me longer and longer to find sessions, more and more matches are decided by whichever map the RNG lands on or if the Killer is rubberbanding into Survivor hitboxes or if a poorly-spawned wall blocks off a generator. I do not recommend this game. Don't keep giving these devs money. I might pop into a match or two every now and then, but I'm not buying any DLC or cosmetics. I hope another true competitor comes around soon.
